archimate:Principle.name: Structured beats Unstructured
archimate:Principle.documentation:
Anglian Water recognises that, in order for data to be linked to other related data, it must be captured as structured data rather than unstructured textual data long text.
Anglian Water recognises that, in order to be able to consolidate, aggregate, analyse, sort, search, explore, and leverage data effectively, it should be captured as structured data rather than unstructured textual data long text.
Where business-critical information is currently captured as unstructured textual data, either via line of business systems, online interfaces, or desktop documents and spreadsheet files, those data capture forms and mechanisms should be reworked so as to capture the same information as structured data.
Where relevant, information embedded within existing documents should be rationalised and optimised into structured datasets, which can be fed into formatted documents rather than embedded in the documents themselves.
Business taxonomy should be rationalised and regulated in areas where it is currently lacking so that incoming data is consistently structured, rather than potentially subjective or descriptive, and in need of manual processing.
For data to be effectively integrated, consolidated,aggregated, sorted, searched, analysed, and explored,it should be structured rather than unstructured.
